page.title: 09Copsale Post Office and shop
page.content: The first question we asked was were they scared about burglaries. We got an abrupt answer NO.Then we found out that in 1889 it was a{blacksmiths forge.It changed 27 years later into the{Nuthurst Arms}, but it was not a pub for long because it became a shop in 1918 (two years later).We asked the {value of their stock}when they were fully stocked. It would come to about {Â£4000-Â£5000}.Their oldest products are butter and cheese.The{opening times are (in the week) 9.00am - 5.30pm. On Saturday its only open from 9.00am - 1.00pm (it's not open on Sundays). There are two big deliveries a week, from either{Chichester}or{Maidstone. The most bought product is groceries. The people who own the shop are Mr and Mrs Gladdish. They have to keep the post office open but the shop brings in more money.
